amendment.description: Amendment sought to require a study on the health impacts of increased air pollution in communities surrounding the refineries that will transport diluted bitumen through the proposed Keystone XL pipeline before any approval of the pipeline could be granted.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 9 printed in House Report 112-181 to require a study on the health impacts of increased air pollution in communities surrounding the refineries that will transport diluted bitumen through the proposed Keystone XL pipeline.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Johnson (GA) amendment (A009) Failed by recorded vote: 163 - 263 (Roll no. 647).

action.text: House amendment not agreed to: On agreeing to the Johnson (GA) amendment (A009) Failed by recorded vote: 163 - 263 (Roll no. 647).
Amendment failed in Committee of the Whole
Roll call votes on amendments in House
House amendment offered/reported by: Amendment (A009) offered by Mr. Johnson (GA).
